meanings.definition: A hasty or careless drawing or writing
meanings.sent1: The child's scribbles on the paper were colorful and joyful.
meanings.sent2: I found some scribbles on the back of an old receipt.
meanings.sent3: The cat left tiny scribbles of paw prints all over the wet paint.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a canvas of chaotic scribbles, waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent5: The artist's scribbles seemed to dance across the page with wild abandon.

meanings.definition: A series of meaningless marks or lines
meanings.sent1: The wall was covered in strange scribbles that no one could understand.
meanings.sent2: The notebook was filled with scribbles that looked like secret codes.
meanings.sent3: The scribbles on the map led them in circles, lost in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The scribbles on the cave walls seemed to tell a story from ancient times.
meanings.sent5: The detective tried to make sense of the scribbles left at the crime scene.

meanings.definition: To write or draw hastily or carelessly
meanings.sent1: She scribbles down notes during the lecture to remember the key points.
meanings.sent2: He scribbles his signature quickly at the bottom of the contract.
meanings.sent3: The child scribbles on the walls with crayons when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: The author scribbles ideas in a notebook, hoping to turn them into a story.
meanings.sent5: The student scribbles a message on a sticky note to remind themselves of a task.
